column4: is it possible to use virtualization on any type of processor, for e.g. running Windows games on Ubuntu?
thanks, i know about WINE .. it just don't thinks its an ideal solution .. i was wondering if virtualization could give near 100% compatibility for a gamer
oh i see
Wine works for a lot of the most popular games
Nah, not at all, two quick commands in the command line and all you need to do is update and upgrade as normal and it will pull down the newest wine's
yeah, thats what i'm talking about .. not a solution for the general populace
All you have to do is copy and paste two lines? after that the .exe's work just like in windows by double clicking
wget -q http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/apt/387EE263.gpg -O- | sudo apt-key add - && sudo wget http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/apt/sources.list.d/hardy.list -O /etc/apt/sources.list.d/winehq.list
Once you do that you'll never have to worry about it again ;)

Gaming does work out of the box. Installing Windows applications in Linux doesn't, for obvious reasons. If you are incapable of copy pasting then you'll have a very rough time on any operating system, Windows, Linux, Mac, doesn't matter.

aw, come on .. dont oversimply things to make Linux look something it isnt .. you know as well as i that ordinary people need to walk a long distance before getting to the point of even having the commands to copy-paste
Normal people=morons? All I did was google how to install wine, and it gave me those two commands to copy paste. It's really not some kind of tricky sorcery like you're making it out to be.
I consider normal people people capable of using a search engine, that's really not asking that much ;)

and I'm saying that if you think it's asking too much for someone to type something into google and copy and paste the result, then those people probably aren't going to do so well on any OS. So it's not really a linux problem

Well, if they'd come in here and ask, or go to the forums, or I don't know, try to better themselves in any way whatsoever? That's like saying how are people supposed to use a search engine? They aren't born witht hat knowledge.
people are trained to use search engines in school or at their job .. they arent trained to know some obscure command for an OS that only a fraction of them will ever user
